channel.title: R on PORTFOLIO
channel.description: Recent content in R on PORTFOLIO

item.title: Cluster Analysis for Portfolio Selection
item.description: We implement a hierarchical risk parity portfolio (LdP2016) for assets to explore the use of cluster analysis for portfolio constructive and compare this with standard mean-variance methods. The data will be sourced from Bloomberg. We will attempt to combine the HRP portfolio with the mean-variance portfolio using the Historical Simulation with Flexible Probabilities (HS-FP) framework developed by Meucci(M2010). Theoretical Proficiencies: Stochastic processes, optimization theory, portfolio theory

item.title: Keep the Heart Unwrinkled
item.description: This paper estimates the effect of old age pension on South African adult life satisfaction across four races, namely African, Coloured, Indian-Asian and White using the NIDS Wave 5 2017 dataset. Multiple linear regression was used to estimate the effect of explanatory variables on life satisfaction. The observed results are limited to the simplified techniques used in regression analysis. The paper finds receipt of pension to have an economically insignificant decrease in life satisfaction.

item.title: A Package for the Analysis of Neural Networks
item.description: Neural Networks provide a flexible basis for constructing non-linear models of real-world phenomena. Indeed, in recent times the model class has become an extremely popular tool amongst applied scientists owing both to its performance over a wide range of statistical tasks as well as the air of sentience that surrounds the internal functioning of the classâ€”the result of well chosen metaphors for describing the basic mathematical operations that define it.
